00019 --
00020 -- unit name: nanofip (nanofip / nanofip)
00021 --
00022 --! @mainpage NanoFIP
00023 --! <HR>
00024 --! @section intro_sec Introduction
00025 --! The NanoFIP is an FPGA component implementing the WorldFIP protocol that
00026 --! can be used in field devices able to communicate at the three standard 
00027 --! speeds. The NanoFIP, that is developed as part of the WorldFIP insourcing
00028 --! project, is designed to be radiation tolerant by using different single 
00029 --! event upset mitigation techniques such as triple module redundancy. \n\n
00030 --! The NanoFIP design is to be implemented in an Actel ProASIC3 Flash family
00031 --! FPGA that is supposedly to not loose its configuration or have serious
00032 --! total dose effects or latchup problems. SEE still exists but should not 
00033 --! give any problems because of SEE mitigation techniques used in the NanoFIP 
00034 --! design. \n
00035 --! \n
00036 --! The device is used in conjunction with a FielDrive driver chip and FieldTR
00037 --! insulating transformer, both available from the company ALSTOM. 
00038 --!
00039 --! <HR>
00040 --! @section more_sec More information
00041 --! This design is based on the <em>NanoFIP functional specification v1.2</em> 
00042 --! http://www.ohwr.org/twiki/pub/OHR/CernFIP/WP3/cernfip_fspec1_2.pdf
00043 --!
00044 --! Complete information about this project at 
00045 --! http://www.ohwr.org/twiki/bin/view/OHR/CernFIP/ \n\n
00046 --! 
00047 --! <HR>
00048 --! @image html nanofip_image_1s.gif "Block diagram of the NanoFIP design"
00049 --!
00050 --! @author Erik van der Bij (Erik.van.der.Bij@cern.ch)

00052 --! @date 07/07/2009

00078 --! @brief Top level design file of nanofip
00079 --============================================================================
00080 --============================================================================
00081 --! Entity declaration for nanofip
00082 --============================================================================
00083 --============================================================================
00084 
00085 entity nanofip is
00086 
00087 port (
00088 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00089 -- WorldFIP settings
00090 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00091       --! Bit rate         \n
00092       --! 00: 31.25 kbit/s \n
00093       --! 01: 1 Mbit/s     \n
00094       --! 10: 2.5 Mbit/s   \n
00095       --! 11: reserved, do not use
00096    rate_i    : in  std_logic_vector (1 downto 0); --! Bit rate
00097 
00098       --! Subscriber number coding. Station address.
00099    subs_i    : in  std_logic_vector (7 downto 0); --! Subscriber number coding.
00100 
00101       --! Identification selection (see M_ID, C_ID)
00102    s_id_o    : out std_logic_vector (1 downto 0); --! Identification selection
00103 
00104       --! Identification variable settings. 
00105       --! Connect the ID inputs either to Gnd, Vcc, S_ID[0] or S_ID[1] to 
00106       --! obtain different values for the Model data (i=0,1,2,3).\n
00107       --! M_ID[i] connected to: Gnd S_ID0 SID1 Vcc               \n
00108       --! Model [2*i]            0    1    0    1                \n
00109       --! Model [2*i+1]          0    0    1    1
00110    m_id_i    : in  std_logic_vector (3 downto 0); --! Model identification settings
00111 
00112       --! Constructor identification settings.
00113       --! Connect the ID inputs either to Gnd, Vcc, S_ID[0] or S_ID[1] to 
00114       --! obtain different values for the Model data (i=0,1,2,3).\n
00115       --! C_ID[i] connected to: Gnd S_ID0 SID1 Vcc               \n
00116       --! Constructor[2*i]       0    1    0    1                \n
00117       --! Constructor[2*i+1]     0    0    1    1
00118    c_id_i    : in  std_logic_vector (3 downto 0); --! Constructor identification settings
00119 
00120       --! Produced variable data length \n
00121       --! 000: 2 Bytes                  \n
00122       --! 001: 8 Bytes                  \n
00123       --! 010: 16 Bytes                 \n
00124       --! 011: 32 Bytes                 \n
00125       --! 100: 64 Bytes                 \n
00126       --! 101: 124 Bytes                \n
00127       --! 110: reserved, do not use     \n
00128       --! 111: reserved, do not use     \n
00129       --! Actual size: +1 NanoFIP Status byte +1 MPS Status byte (last transmitted) 
00130       --! Note: when SLONE=Vcc, p3_lgth_i should be set to 000.
00131    p3_lgth_i : in  std_logic_vector (2 downto 0); --! Produced variable data length
00132 
00133 
00134 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00135 --  FIELDRIVE connections
00136 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00137    fd_rstn_o : out std_logic; --! Initialisation control, active low
00138    fd_wdgn_i : in  std_logic; --! Watchdog on transmitter
00139    fd_txer_i : in  std_logic; --! Transmitter error
00140    fd_txena_o: out std_logic; --! Transmitter enable
00141    fd_txck_o : out std_logic; --! Line driver half bit clock
00142    fx_txd_o  : out std_logic; --! Transmitter data
00143    fx_rxa_i  : in  std_logic; --! Reception activity detection
00144    fx_rxd_i  : in  std_logic; --! Receiver data
00145 
00146 
00147 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00148 --  USER INTERFACE, General signals
00149 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00150    uclk_i    : in  std_logic; --! 40 MHz clock
00151 
00152       --! Stand-alone mode
00153       --! If connected to Vcc, disables sending of NanoFIP status together with 
00154       --! the produced data.
00155    slone_i   : in  std_logic; --! Stand-alone mode
00156 
00157       --! No NanoFIP status transmission
00158       --! If connected to Vcc, disables sending of NanoFIP status together with 
00159       --! the produced data.
00160    nostat_i  : in  std_logic; --! No NanoFIP status transmission
00161 
00162    rstin_i   : in  std_logic; --! Initialisation control, active low
00163 
00164       --! Reset output, active low. Active when the reset variable is received 
00165       --! and the second byte contains the station address.
00166    rston_o   : out std_logic; --! Reset output, active low
00167 
00168 
00169 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00170 --  USER INTERFACE, non WISHBONE
00171 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00172 
00173       --! Signals new data is received and can safely be read (Consumed 
00174       --! variable 05xyh). In stand-alone mode one may sample the data on the 
00175       --! first clock edge VAR1_RDY is high.
00176    var1_rdy_o: out std_logic; --! Variable 1 ready
00177 
00178       --! Signals that the user logic is accessing variable 1. Only used to 
00179       --! generate a status that verifies that VAR1_RDY was high when 
00180       --! accessing. May be grounded.
00181    var1_acc_i: in  std_logic; --! Variable 1 access
00182 
00183       --! Signals new data is received and can safely be read (Consumed 
00184       --! broadcast variable 04xyh). In stand-alone mode one may sample the 
00185       --! data on the first clock edge VAR1_RDY is high.
00186    var2_rdy_o: out std_logic; --! Variable 2 ready
00187 
00188       --! Signals that the user logic is accessing variable 2. Only used to 
00189       --! generate a status that verifies that VAR2_RDY was high when 
00190       --! accessing. May be grounded.
00191    var2_acc_i: in  std_logic; --! Variable 2 access
00192 
00193       --! Signals that the variable can safely be written (Produced variable 
00194       --! 06xyh). In stand-alone mode, data is sampled on the first clock after
00195       --! VAR_RDY is deasserted.
00196    var3_rdy_o: out std_logic; --! Variable 3 ready
00197 
00198       --! Signals that the user logic is accessing variable 3. Only used to 
00199       --! generate a status that verifies that VAR3_RDY was high when 
00200       --! accessing. May be grounded.
00201    var3_acc_i: in  std_logic; --! Variable 3 access
00202 
00203 
00204 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00205 --  USER INTERFACE, WISHBONE SLAVE
00206 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00207    wclk_i    : in  std_logic; --! Wishbone clock. May be independent of UCLK.
00208 
00209       --! Data in. Wishbone access only on bits 7-0. Bits 15-8 only used
00210       --! in stand-alone mode.
00211    dat_i     : in  std_logic_vector (15 downto 0); --! Data in
00212 
00213       --! Data out. Wishbone access only on bits 7-0. Bits 15-8 only used
00214       --! in stand-alone mode.
00215    dat_o     : out std_logic_vector (15 downto 0); --! Data out
00216    adr_i     : in  std_logic_vector ( 9 downto 0); --! Address
00217    rst_i     : in  std_logic; --! Wishbone reset. Does not reset other internal logic.
00218    stb_i     : in  std_logic; --! Strobe
00219    ack_o     : out std_logic; --! Acknowledge
00220    we_i      : in  std_logic  --! Write enable
00221 
00222 );
00223 
00224 end entity nanofip;
00225 --============================================================================
00226 -- end of entity declaration
00227 --============================================================================

00293 
00294 --! Architecture contains only connectivity
00295 architecture struc of nanofip is
00296 begin
00297 
00298 --! Placeholder for Consumed RAM
00299 cmp_consumed_ram: consumed_ram
00300    port map (); --! place holder for ports
00301 
00302 --! Placeholder for Produced RAM
00303 cmp_produced_ram: produced_ram
00304    port map (); --! place holder for ports
00305 
00306 --! Placeholder for Produced ROM
00307 cmp_produced_rom: produced_rom
00308    port map (); --! place holder for ports
00309 
00310 --! Placeholder for WorldFIP engine
00311 cmp_wf_engine: wf_engine
00312    port map (); --! place holder for ports
00313 
00314 --! Placeholder for Transmitter engine
00315 cmp_tx_engine: tx_engine
00316    port map (); --! place holder for ports
00317 
00318 --! Placeholder for WorldFIP transmitter/receiver
00319 cmp_wf_tx_rx: wf_tx_rx
00320    port map (); --! place holder for ports
00321 
00322 --! Placeholder for User Data interface
00323 cmp_data_if: data_if
00324    port map (); --! place holder for ports
00325 
00326 --! Placeholder for Reset logic
00327 cmp_reset_logic: reset_logic
00328    port map (); --! place holder for ports
00329 
00330 --! Placeholder for Clock generator
00331 cmp_clock_gen: clock_gen
00332    port map (); --! place holder for ports
00333 
00334 --! Placeholder for Settings generator
00335 cmp_settings: settings
00336    port map (); --! place holder for ports
00337 
00338 end architecture struc;
